The grounds were lush with beautiful flowers and plants. The amenities were plentiful. 3-4 different pools - some for adults, some for families. Great fitness room w/spa. Golf. You name it - it has it. The staff was very helpful and hospitable. Definitely plan to return next time we're on the West Coast!

Reviews.Title: “Step into a Southern California Charm...”
Reviews.Author: funtroopers4
Reviews.Content: We were visiting the area for our niece's high school graduation and we just loved this understated, unpretentious gem! The grounds are lovely, beautifully laid out. We were greeted by the most friendly, hospitable, welcoming staff. We enjoyed watching not only nature from our room balcony, but the fun golf event on their amazing course. The kids just reminded me- that the beds were sooooo comfortable with an awesome Big flatscreen TV too! We look forward to returning and staying longer, so we can personally truly enjoy the Spa, pool, golf, and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: jlr33
Reviews.Content: Rancho Bernardo Inn is truly an oasis. I had a an amazing spa treatment in one of their spa casitas with tropical ingredients and we dined at the signature restaurant El Bizcocho. The chef made us a one-of-a-kind tasting that consisted of the most interesting and delicious ingredients, it was an amazing experience. I am not a golfer, but the course looked beautiful and we spent the majority of the day by the pool enjoying the sun and the peace. All in all, it was a perfect staycation for us!

Reviews.Title: “The Spa and outdoor casitas were heavenly!”
Reviews.Author: izzyjr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to get away for a little staycation after a long week at work and snuck away for one night to the Rancho Bernardo Inn. Our room was absolutely beautiful overlooking the golf course so clean and very big! We decided to use the spa and get some of the made fresh daily massage packages - the one I got was the Latin and it was absolutely heavenly! My massage therapist Jill had a very skilled hand and I left the massage revived and relaxed (oh and smelly spicy from the signature oils they blended for the custom massage. After our spa we decided to hit up El Bizcocho and try the tasting menu, we had heard there was a new chef. The food was very creative we did a five course tasting that included the chefs using some of the most ingredients that took us back to our childhood including pop rocks and a fruit rollup that complimented the yummiest salmon! We had a chance to enjoy the adult pool after our stay in the comfy beds and had breakfast overlooking the golf course. Service at the property was fantastic we will absolutely be back to the Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Day at the spa”
Reviews.Author: PrettykittySanDiego
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I decided we needed some well earned relaxation and booked the massage with the spa lunch. The service was great and the spa was clean and relaxing!! I upgraded to the deep tissue massage and was not disappointed!! My masseuse was incredible and I felt like jello! After a nice dip in the jacuzzi and a great shower (I love how big they are), we were asked where we would like to enjoy our lunch. It was raining and we ended up sitting under a cabana by the pool with a bottle of wine, our great food and caught up. It was so relaxing I didn't want to go home!!! If you are looking for a great escape to relax...this is the perfect spot!

Reviews.Title: “Best Mothers Day Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: D29andK
Reviews.Content: This is the second year in a row that our family (as well as four other families) have gone to the RB Inn for Mothers Day Weekend. We love the property! It is like a hidden gem in San Diego! The golf course and tennis courts are amazing and the Mom's rave about the spa. The kids love the pool areas and the putting competitions. The Mothers Day Brunch is top notch and if you feel like splurging, El Bizcocho is a five star dining experience! Unbelievable! The rooms are extremely nice and my wife wants to find out how to buy one of the beds and all the bedding for our house. The staff was extremely professional, courteous and accomodating. We look forward to next mothers day as this is becomming a annual tradition for us.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds ... Hotel Fees Are To Much !!!!”
Reviews.Author: BTOWN72008
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend for a near by Girls Softball Tournament... Booked this property online through Priceline. I was looking for a 31/2 star location near Poway. The Rancho Bernardo Inn is not on the website. Ended up getting it for $75 per night with no mention of a $20 dollar resort fee and $10 dollar parking fee. This made me mad upon check-in. The parking lot is ridiculous to park in on the weekend. I would pay $2 more for Vallet, although that line was very long. Our room was on the 2nd floor with a courtyard view.(no elevators, so be where...) The room was nicely decorated with under bed lighting(My daughter thought that was cool) .We had a frig stocked with beer, soda, water and some snacks, hence the $20 fee. It was leaking and had to continually wipe up water off the floor. The beds were comfortable , but the towels left a lot to be desired. they were small and rough. not a high quality. The coffee bar in the room was not fully stocked. We enjoyed our stay, but I would stay on the first floor closer to the pool. I tried for days to contact the hotel directly to pull up my online reservation,but they always said they didn't have it yet.. They need to let online bookers know in advance the fees they charge at this resort, regardless if you use the items in the frig or not. Parking should be free as the lot is a nightmare and the spots are very small , tight and quit a distance to walk if you don't get one up front by the vallet. The staff was very friendly..

Reviews.Title: “dirty and disgusting”
Reviews.Author: chandra1
Reviews.Content: would call it a motel, if you are part of a conference you may get perks, if your a lowly regular guest get ready to hear its for the group, we are all booked up because of the group,i cant accommodate a different room, dining or spa. Our room was dark and dirty, wouldnt go back if it were free. Couldn't wait to leave. Disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wedding reception May 15th 2010 $$$$$$$$”
Reviews.Author: Camie41
Reviews.Content: Vevy nice Inn, stayed in room 520 way in the back. too far too walk after dancing all night. They need some type of shuttle service for there customesr who pay a lot of money to stay there and have there wedding there. Rooms are really nice, housekeeping could of did a better job of cleaning and wiping down the TV remote control, it was really dirty, the bed was very comfortable. I wish they would offer late night or 24 room service.

Reviews.Title: “Great get away”
Reviews.Author: fliguytom
Reviews.Content: A wonderful weekend trip. Beautiful fountains everywhere, nice golf cource, great pools and hot tubs, world class spa and restaraunts and great service. If you need a break this was a great place to recharge yor batterys.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely grounds, staff and Spa, linens and fees, not so much”
Reviews.Author: Atplayonegirl
Reviews.Content: Heeding all the advice on Trip Advisor, I booked through Hotels.com which included the resort fee, though the receptionist at the front desk tried to charge me anyway, I brought receipt of booking and inclusion of the fee. The valet parking is for a 24 hour period and ours was waived as the check out agent felt it wasn't worth charging the card, nice. Not so nice is four days after check-out I am looking at a pending change for $100 on my credit card that I can't get a straight answer about and I really hate these type of errors and disputes from an establishment that sees itself as elite in customer service. The grounds are beautiful, the pool at the spa is saline and 82 degrees, the pools in the main inn area are also heated and open till 11, and the hot tubs are very nice as well. These "upgraded linens" that are boasted about on the website are a joke. I can sleep well at a Motel 6, but I literally lost 3 hours trying to fall asleep on rock hard pillows and the comforters are polyester filled with lumps. The rooms are perfectly nice, but not much more. There is not an elevator in the whole place, so be prepared to haul your luggage up or down stairs if you are not one who calls for a bellhop. I would recommend the Spa to a friend, but no the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice to relax”
Reviews.Author: STLHonesty
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful! More for a couple who likes to golf and take andvantage of the spa treatments. Not much to do off the resort but can have plenty of time to enjoy the company of a loved one (one on one time). The staff was outstanding, you can tell they all have been with the resort for many years and they do not plan on leaving...everyone loves their job! Love the view and all the remodeling! Would love to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Not with it with all the "fees" totalled at the end”
Reviews.Author: chmura
Reviews.Content: So I got a good deal at this hotel. That is the reason why I stayed here. I stayed here for two nights. First the room was okay. Nothing special. Everything looked pretty dated. I read on their website that they did a multimillion dollar renovation. But I did not see anything of any sort in the room. Just a new flat screen TV. Towards the end of my 2 day stay when I got the bill under the door. It was for $65 dollars. $20 per day resort fee, $10 per day parking, $2.50 per day occupancy tax. I think they went over board to charge for parking. I understand when you get a hotel in a downtown area where space is limited and parking is underground and it costs to engineer these structures. But this hotel is in the middle of no where with TONS of open space for parking. Its not like you can take public transportation there. You HAVE to drive. So I will never stay here again with the ridiculous $65.00 charge at the end of my 2 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing, luxurious resort in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: pchas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the RBI when I was on a 3-day conference, and I enjoyed the ambiance of the place. The Spanish colonial decor is very in keeping with the area. The grounds are beautiful, with Mediterranean courtyards and fountains. There are four computers for guest use, two in the lobby and two in the cafe, and a big flat screen TV in the room. The food served at the receptions was good, but not great--too many fried things. I did not have a chance to try the spa or the El Bizcocho Restaurant, but the food served at the bar was decent and very reasonably priced. The Veranda Restaurant was closed for remodeling. The property is rather remote, well off the freeway in the middle of a residential neighborhood, so it is not a place to stay if you are in the area for sightseeing or nightlife, but for a relaxing escape, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary & Happy New Year”
Reviews.Author: lotsobiztravel
Reviews.Content: Mostly travel for business in our lives, it was nice to stop for a second and relax. Their spa is incredible and so is the spa pool. Room was very comfortable. The staff went out of their way and we could tell, even the ones that had to work New Years Eve. Friendly, relaxing, quiet, romantic, perfect. (golf too if you are into that....I am not....but it looks good)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to relax”
Reviews.Author: ScNebraskatraveler
Reviews.Content: After watching our Huskers win the Holiday Bowl, our party went to Rancho Bernardo Inn to see the New Year in. The recent renovations brought back the beauty of the place and was absolutely the best stay we've had in a long time. The staff was so accommodating and couldn't do enough for us. The food for New Year's Eve was excellent and the decorations for the Holidays were really special. We would recommend this resort to anyone wanting a first class stay.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: pua1938
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very immaculate, felt like it was a 5 star resort and spa. The only thing was that the gym was under renovation, but they gave us free 24 hr fitness passes, we had to drive to it but better then nothing. The bed was comfy, the best I ever had so far at any hotel The staff was very nice and accomodating. It looked really christmasy with the beautiful decorations. Will definetly stay there again in the near future

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at RB Inn and Spa”
Reviews.Author: SK8TRMOMSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Myhusband surprised me for my birthday with a stay at the Rancho Bernardo Inn. Even though we live in San Diego, I felt like I was on vacation. Great service, excellent food and a beautiful property...very quiet and relaxing. We also enjoyed first rate spa services at their beautiful spa that has one of the most gorgeous pools and cabana setups I have ever seen at a spa. In addition, our massages were done in private Japanese style houses. The following morning our children joined us for our Thanksgiving dinner on the Veranda. Overall, it exceeded my expectations and I would recommend it to anyone - whether for business or for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: newt26
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn for a wedding. Had I known it would be such a beautiful place I would have stayed longer. The staff was so friendly and accommodating! The grounds were beautiful, the rooms were great, and the spa is a must. I would love to come back. I was pleasantly surprised since I had never heard of this place before. Even though a short trip it was so relaxing. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Will never return again!”
Reviews.Author: thefriesfamily6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at RBI because we have stayed at other JC Resort Properties and we loved the service and atmosphere of the resorts and thought since this one was close to home we would give it a try. This place, compared to other similarly rated properties was very disappointing. We wanted to check out as soon as we arrived. There was a long and confusing hike to find our hotel room. Prior to arriving Arlene in the spa bent over backwards to accommodate our last minute requests at the spa. Because of all of her hard work and professionalism we decided to give RBI another chance. Arlene in the spa was so accommodating and welcoming we decided to tolerate a lot more than we normally would have. When we arrived in the room it was nice and clean with what appeared to be a lowly budgeted recent remodel. When we sat on the bed, the mattress slid across the frame mounting about 6 inches. The frame of the bed was too big for the mattress! The bed was extremely uncomfortable. You could hear springs in the mattress all night and neither my husband or I got a good night sleep! I ended up with bruises on my legs from banging them on the frame every time I got out of bed. The only nice thing I can say about this place is the spa was a wonderful experience and the atmosphere of the grounds is beautiful. Our hotel rate included 2 spa treatments with each night stay for $268. Which is a great deal if the room had not been so miserable. I have been to better spas, but everyone was quite professional and caring. My husband chose to have the signature massage and I chose the aroma therapy facial. We also opt'd for the spa pedicure, which in my opinion was a waste of money. The environment for the pedicure was not in the spa area and the bench seat was very uncomfortable. The room was attached to the fitness area and was very loud and non-relaxing. The spa has a nice dressing room area with all of the amenities, 3 showers and plenty of lockers. While waiting for your treatment you can enjoy a private men or women only steam room and jacuzzi, the saline pool or co-gender jacuzzi, or relax in the cabanas that are included for spa members only. Needless to say the night only got worse when we went to the Veranda Dining area and were highly disappointed by the very low quality of the food offered there. The ambiance was amazing as it sits outside overlooking the golf course but we could have gotten better food from Denny's down the road! Overall it was nice to have a weekend away with my husband but I would highly recommend that you consider another place unless you are used to the Holiday Inn level or lower of accommodations. The grounds are beautiful. If you live locally, I would recommend a visit to the spa!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Golfluver
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in North San Diego County is the Rancho Bernardo Inn. With its classic vintage grounds and large terrace overlooking a first class Golf course and great food, you feel you are hundreds of miles away from home. We live in San Diego, got married there, celebrate our anniversary and enjoy numerous brunches throughout the year at the RBI. The newly added spa/pool area is wonderfull, relaxing and serene. Golf at the RBI is fun, challanging and just a beautiful setting. There is something for everyone there and I highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “RB Inn...a little bit of luxury in the 'burbs!”
Reviews.Author: travelisf0rme
Reviews.Content: Since we live in the San Diego North County area, we thought we would try out the RB Inn...and we weren't disappointed! The hotel is beautiful...nestled in the many golf courses in RB and has an amazing spa. The Inn is first class and even has Aveda products in the rooms! If you go, be sure to dine in El Bizchoco (their tasting menu is incredible) for a truly gourmet meal!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdbruin
Reviews.Content: The RB Inn has done some renovations over the last couple years that really add to the hotel. They added a nice new spa and some ballrooms. The rooms are still big and nice, however the air conditioning unit was so loud it kept us up all night.

Reviews.Title: “The Spa is a MUST”
Reviews.Author: ElaineG29
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a stay at the Rancho Bernardo Inn SPA. It was amazing. The people were all superior and professional and the Warm Stones Massage was heavenly! The pool and outdoor treatment rooms are amazing and completely zen-like. I could spend every day there. They have individual cabanas for the spa guests and even deliver room service to them. I had the most amazing Ahi salad poolside. The relaxation rooms are comfortable and well stocked. The pools are saline and super to swim in. You must make a trip here if at all possible!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but the staff isn't much help”
Reviews.Author: Foodie4OC
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful but each and every time (no kidding) I asked any member of the staff for anything (whether it was directions, info on the hotel, etc...) no one seemed to know anything. I was there for a wedding and when I checked in, I received someone else's gift bag. That is how my stay started.

Reviews.Title: “worst of the worst”
Reviews.Author: eiffeltravel
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel...grounds and pools but not too clean...you do expect much better for this kind of hotel...the room was good...no bottle of water for welcome as most these hotels worldwide offer...a resort fee of $20 for internet, and coffee machine which we did not use any of these 2 and also the resort fee is charged if you are using the room safe....wow...look like they charge the room and also the equipment...never heard this in my entire life and anywhere else...i never travel to san diego, my first and last time...but i do travel all over the world in most cases in 4 and 5 stars hotels.... the service from the reservation to the restaurant booking and the service was mistakes after mistakes no apologies whatsoever...really ridiculous... the service does not exist so be on your own...good luck... of course i suggest that all of the guests really refuse to go in this kind of property and no wonder they donot belong to the business bureau...it will be too many complaintd to handle...yes the overall property was nice but nothing extraordinary and after all the frustrations we have been through, the average score is a generous 1...even motel 6 might do better on the overall score...

Reviews.Title: “LOVE RANCHO BERNARDO INN”
Reviews.Author: fredboon
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn on several occassions and I must say it is one of the best resorts in San Diego. The grounds are beautiful and peaceful. The rooms are warm and relaxing and the decor is updated. But the best part is the bes, pillows, and linensâ€”heavenly!!! My husband loves the golf! And, I love everything else about RBI!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay everyone very Friendly and Helpfull”
Reviews.Author: wpgjet
Reviews.Content: I went there for my second time and was very please I went over the weekend of Labor Day , The front desk was very helpfull . Room was very clean and service at the pool was amazing , I ran into the GM there who I think his Name was Mr Gates and he stopped and chatted with me and asked how my stay was going , Very Friendly and personable , Will stay there next time for sure . 2 Thumbs up from this happy camper

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic visit to wonderful property with all amenities for couples and families”
Reviews.Author: jrfletcher
Reviews.Content: We decided to visit the Rancho Bernardo Inn with our children for our 18th anniversary. We brought along our 15 and 11 year old and wanted it to be family time and couples time. It all turned out great. We had several great meals (breakfasts and great dinner...including Friday night buffet at the Veranda) at both restaurants and quick service location and the food and service was outstanding. We also visited the spa and fitness center on multiple occasions and found them clean, well managed and staffed with courteous associates. We would visit the resort again in a heartbeat and truly got a weekend away of both family and couples time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: christigreg
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in the other reviews the website is very deceiving with their photos. This place is very old and run down on the outside, however the room we were in was nicely remodeled. The pool they show online is not the pool you are allowed to use unless you have booked at the spa for that day but no where do they mention that, as stated in other reviews the pools you are allowed to use are no better than a motel 6 pool. The pools are not conveniently located by the rooms so we only used it 1 time. There is no elevators, where we were located was the 2nd floor in the middle of the hotel so up 2 flights of stairs and down the long hallway was no fun at all with luggage and children, this was everytime we left. I will say that the staff was friendly until check out. At check out we were hit with an unexpected additional 232.00 to out hotel bill. We were there for 7 nights/8 days and were charged a 20.00 a night resort fee (that covered the so called free internet) and an additional 10.00 a night parking fee so the additional 30.00 a night added up. We were not told about this fee upon check in yet the hotel manager was not willing to do anything for us so we were stuck paying that. We also ordered room service breakfast one morning for our family of 4 and an additional 20.00 was added to that bill,18% gratuity and a tip, on top of that they expect another tip when delivered (this is standard in all hotels for room service, so not just this one) but when you are paying that kind of money you would expect the food to be delivered hot, but it was cold so our 80.00 breakfast was no good at all. I hate to see what dinner for 4 would have cost us as everything in the resort was very over priced. I was so upset at check out that honestly if I were offerd a free week there I would turn it down so fast. I was very unhappy with this place and have no desire to ever step foot on this property again as I have stayed at nicer Holiday Inns. Please do not expect much from this hotel when booking, ask about any additional fees up front and you may have an ok stay but for the nightly rate they charge I would really really recommend another resort. Oh and the resort is full of cobb webs they dont even try to clean up. Our balcony was covered with them, so gross we would not use it and above our door hanging from the light for 2 days was a spider with its dead dragonfly and you would think room service would take a broom or something and try to clean it up.

Reviews.Title: “Please update this hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rosebudmi
Reviews.Content: The Rancho Bernardo Inn used to be a lovely hotel. I can tell even though I had not been there before this stay. It is now a bit worn, and it needs some tender loving care. But, with the emphasis on service, I think they will do well. I cannot complain at all about the service received at this hotel...it was TOP NOTCH! The staff is well-trained in how diffuse difficult situations, and although we had a few hitches during our stay, I would definitely give them another chance. Due to some flooding issues, we had to change rooms, but they upgraded us to a nice room with a better view (golf course). Too bad the air-conditioning didn't work very well in our room, but thankfully it was cool at night so we could have our balcony doors open to welcome the breeze. To also make amends for our inconvenience, they provided us with a fruit, cracker and cheese basket as well as a bottle of Evian. We also received 2 free breakfasts. And to ensure our giving them another chance, they recently sent me a free night's stay good for a year. My husband and I definitely plan to take them up on this offer as we enjoyed playing golf there. Hopefully the golf course will be in tip top condition when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: FasTxn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a residential area away from traffic. Very quiet and relaxing. It is ranch style, very spread out.. The room was nice and the staff was great. Free internet, free parking and our package had free breakfast. I agree with one of the other reviewers, the air conditioning needs work. It never seemed to cool the room comfortably. It felt like damp air sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “The $19/night Survivor Package was a really great deal - but bring lightbulbs & park outside resort on street.”
Reviews.Author: Tw0Fr0mSanDieg0
Reviews.Content: We got one of the $19/night Survivor Package rooms and stayed Fri. & Sat. nights. (It was actually $34/night because they tack on a $15 "resort fee".) With the Survivor Package, you camp out in the room - no lights, towels, soap, shampoo, or even a bed. But there's electricity and we brought 5 lightbulbs so we had plenty of light and also free high-speed internet, plus we had our sleeping bags, towels, soap, etc. There's a working refrigerator, safe, and big-screen TV. There's also 2 nice big easy chairs in the room and 2 smaller chairs on the porch. The room was very nice, right near one of the pools. Great pools and jacuzzis. Beautiful grounds. Fabulous lobby building, excellent (expensive!) restaurants(we brought some of our own food), cafe, and sports bar. Wonderful service from nice friendly staff. Huge golf course if you play golf, tennis courts, fitness center, spa, meeting and wedding reception areas, etc. We went on both Sat. and Sun. to nearby wine-tasting rooms in beautiful wineries (Bernardo and Orfila) then spent the rest of the day at RB Inn. The RB Inn charges $10/night for parking though (in a lot a long way from your room), so we unloaded our stuff and then parked outside on the street (about 30 feet further than the resort lot) and saved $20.

Reviews.Title: “If not for the grounds....”
Reviews.Author: make4
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the Rancho Bernardo Inn are gorgeous. However, it is very apparent that the recession is taking a toll. It looks as if they need an additional staff of 20 to keep up with things. The paint is looking old and there are cobwebs everywhere. The sconces in the room adjoining ours (for the kids) were crooked and loose. Our shower looked like it had tiles replaced (poorly) and had two open holes to the back of the shower which were not even caulked. There were holes in the drywall in the main building that had not been repaired. In addition, the railings were NOT child safe on our balcony. My three year old girls could easily walk between the rails and could have fallen through three stories down. Thus, we did not get to use them. When we ate at the Veranda for dinner, they only had four entrees available (Caesar salad, philly cheese steak and two others (equally uninspiring). With kids, we couldn't really eat at the bar or the "nicer" restaraunt so for all other meals we ate out. This was disappointing as we choose a resort to have a resort experience. The room was nice but the walls were paper thin. We could hear our neighbors just opening their closet doors. This was problematic as we would get our toddlers to bed only to have them be woken up several times by neighbors who truly were not being loud. Right now, the hotel is running a package to appear to be family friendly. However, they have three pools and only allow children in one of the pools which was a hike for us. Every time we tried to eat with the kids in one of the restaurants they did not apply the kids eat free discount and we had to ask them to rerun the bill to apply the discount. (twice -- then we gave up because the selection was so limited). Its a 15 minute drive to get food outside of the resort but there are some decent options around town. The big pro to the hotel for kids are the grounds themselves. We had a great time exploring the resort and took many long walks to look at the beautiful fountains, trees, and flowers. The kids actually loved watching the golfers and we got to talk a lot about the game. If not for the grounds, it would have been comparable to a comfort inn. We could not call this a 5 star hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: flyboy1980
Reviews.Content: I was going to be in the area and the Rancho Bernardo Inn had a decent corporate rate through my corporate travel office. Normally, I'm a chain hotel guru and love to get my points, so I was bit sceptical about not earning any points with my week long stay. Let me just say that this place is very relaxing and a nice change from the chain hotels. Now, its no Bellagio, but very comfy rooms, beautiful location, great food, great staff and very relaxing atmosphere! Even though I won't be gaining any points this stay from my chain hotel friends, I left the Rancho Bernardo Inn much more relaxed than when I arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Well-manicured grounds but pretty average stay”
Reviews.Author: beantown_illini
Reviews.Content: Stayed at RBI over July 4th weekend for a wedding that was held there. It's a nice resort and the grounds are beautiful, but to me, nothing was overwhelmingly impressive. The AC unit in our room was awful â€“ it blew out damp, humid air and even turning it down to the low 60s didnâ€™t seem to cool things. We heard the same from several other guests, too, one of whom had to switch rooms altogether in order to have properly-functioning AC. The room itself was fine - generally comfortable but as far as decor, it was slightly dated. The bed in our room was positioned at an angle which made the room feel smaller than it probably was. Our room had a patio, but unfortunately we never used it because there was a heavily-trafficked path in front of it so there wasn't much privacy. Free wi-fi is available--a big plus in my book. And I loved the Aveda toiletries in the bathroom, which was kept well-stocked! Room service was tasty and reasonably priced, as were poolside drinks. Don't attempt to bring your own drinks into the pool area, though. We saw someone try to but they're big sticklers about that (understandably so). The staff was very friendly, and did an excellent job in terms of the wedding, cocktail hour and reception. It was really well-orchestrated and the meal was great. One other thing to note - the resort isn't in San Diego proper. It's about 30 min. or so north. The hotel doesn't offer a shuttle to/from the airport, but they did recommend Cloud 9 Super Shuttle. Had I known it would take me 1.5 hours to get to the resort via the shuttle, I would've just sucked it up and paid the $75 for a cab. I wouldn't be opposed to staying here again, but it also wouldn't be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: deeann622
Reviews.Content: I took advantage of a special that included a massage at the spa. I had a relaxing time and took advantage of the amenities. The spa is located on the opposite side of the resort from our hotel room. My massage was great and did not feel rushed. I enjoyed the peaceful stroll through the resort and layed out at the adult pool most of the day. We left the resort for a wonderful dinner at Carver's. Breakfast at the resort was okay, but enjoyed the view from the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet, elegant and restful”
Reviews.Author: grazipat
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business trip to Rancho Bernardo so we tagged along with him. He has stayed here before and told us how beatuiful it was. He was right. We traveled with our two teenagers and though the hotel median age was much older, they relaxed and enjoyed themselves in the pools and hot tubs and just enjoying the lovely gardens and grounds. Our room was comfortable and clean, we were able to sleep with the sliding glass doors open and enjoy the cool breezes at night. Breakfast at the Veranda was nice, the outdoor fireplaces are all lit at night and it is relaxing to sit and unwind in front of one of the roaring fires. They smells of rosemary, lavender and magnolia are all around, the gardeners do a fine job here. It is also a twenty to thirty minute drive to all San Diego attractions as well as the beaches of SoCal.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rubyannLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We wanted to find a nice place to stay for the holiday weekend with our two kids and boy did we luck out. The property is beautiful, with fragrant jasmine blooming everywhere. Our package included dinner at the Veranda restaurant and it was delicious. There was a Wii room for the kids with popcorn and ice cream bars. We were lounging around a bonfire by the pool one night and the staff brought out everything we needed to make s'mores. The pool was clean, large and refreshing. It was just a fantastic weekend for adults and kids alike!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: LindySez
Reviews.Content: I don't expect perfect, but when something is amiss, I expect responsive service for it to be corrected, pronto. At the Rancho Bernardo Inn this was my exact experience. The rooms are lovely, nicely appointed with comfortable beds, fluffy cozy comforters, crisp linens. All this with free internet service, either Wi-Fi or plug in. Nice touch. Our room had a large Hi-Def TV. It also had a non-functioning air conditioner. We got in late, and didn't notice it at first, but in the middle of the night, we knew something was amiss, as the cozy comforter was tossed off to the floor and we lay under the sheet...still hot. "I think it's just blowing air" I said. My husband agreed. Next morning we reported it, along with a broken hairdryer (you know people, if you don't let them know things are broken, it can't be fixed - so be sure to report those things); and within an hour all was once again right with the world. Our next night we were able to comfortably cuddle under that cozy comforter. Heads up: there are no elevators. So if you have a second floor room ask for help getting your bags up there, you will be gladly accommodated. If yo have problems with stairs, be sure to ask for a ground floor room. My husband and son played 9 holes of "twilight" golf the next day. The course was beautiful, well kept, manicured greens. The play was slow due to one group playing; it would have been nice to have a Marshall on the course to ask them to "step aside" and let others play through, I don't know where he was but my son played his best 9 holes ever anyway. One caveat: While playing, they bought a hot dog (well, how can you play golf without a hot dog and beer?). My husband set his dog down to play and when he came back he found nothing. HUH? He searched around, found the foil, the bun and the relish scattered all over and then saw the squirrel running up a tree, hot dog in mouth. LindySez: It's a beautiful place to stay, comfort, classy, responsive to your needs. Look for the "GMgonemad" deals on Twitter and watch out for the hot dog stealing squirrels.

Reviews.Title: “Average High End Hotel”
Reviews.Author: twb311
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day conference and RBI. Check in was smooth and efficient. Beware of the $20 resort fee that is in addition to the nightly rate, I do not believe this is negotiable and I consider this sort of fee a hidden charge. Room was spacious. Bathroom is in need of a serious remodel but clean. Sheets and pillows were clean and very comfortable. I found the room itself to be a bit dirty and untidy, but only if you looked closely. Example, a small stain on the chair and the bed lamps were crooked. At a high end hotel I expect nothing to go unnoticed by the cleaning staff. But it was. The staff on property were excellent. The meeting facilities were sufficient and the meals were above average, especially breakfast. If you get a spa, ask for Brianne, she is great.

Reviews.Title: “Business retreat was sweet!”
Reviews.Author: cwcharacters
Reviews.Content: Just back from a business getaway to the Rancho Bernardo Inn. This is a great spot to hold a business meeting and retreat. The place was renovated 2 years ago, yet some of the room details could have been paid closer attention to. The caulking around the shower for instance, was sloppy and some of the tile work crooked. Holes patched were obvious as well. The rooms are quite comfortable and well appointed. Although the walls are very thin and you may easily hear the snorer next door. Aside from those minor annoyances, the hotel shines. The lobby has comfortable seating areas and gives a hacienda feel. The staff is warm, helpful, and friendly. The food, while adequate in the restaurant, was quite tasty during our meetings as well as at the nightly parties. The bar is cozy, albeit a bit dated. The spa is highly rated and was praised by all. Golf was also well enjoyed by my collegues. Meeting space is great for a group of our size (300) and is in a seperate building, away from the main rooms. This made me feel as though, once the meeting was over, I was really able to get away from it all. All-in-all, I'd recommend Rancho Bernardo for it's comfortable surroundings as a business/golfing/spa retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Grounds at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: Wiley12
Reviews.Content: For full disclosure purposes, I use to work at the front desk there so I can still get employee rates from people I still know there. I have stayed at the RBI several times over the years, the most recent being at the end of December. There are many things that are good about RBI and a couple that are not. Good: - The grounds at the Inn are beautiful from the moment you drive onto the property until you get to your room and then from your room to the restaurant or the 1st tee or the spa or the bar (you get the idea). - The rooms are very very nice, depending on where your room is located. The best rooms at the hotel are 600 Building (upstairs), 700 building (upstairs), 500 building (upstairs facing the golf course), then 600 downstairs and 700 downstairs. If you cannot get into one of those room assignments the quality of the rooms drop off considerably in terms of size and location. - I love the room service at the Inn. Very quick and very very good. Breakfast is the best and I recommend the eggs benedict. - Personally, I think the staff goes out of its way to be friendly and accomodating to guests. I know this because I remember how much that they would get on you if you were not. It's highly encouraged to be friendly to guests. Not As Good: - Any of the rooms that were not mentioned above. For the standard price of the room it is not worth it. - The cost of the drinks in the bar. For the cost of the drinks you would think that you were downtown at the W or the Solamar. The bar is a great setting with lots of seats and TV's and a pool table but the cost of the cocktails is high.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rancho Bernardo - Great Historical Resort”
Reviews.Author: naport44
Reviews.Content: From the moment you step into the lobby you feel the history of this old California resort. We had a great stay at this resort, and will return on our next visit to the San Diego area. Rooms were above average, with renovations done to everything but the bathrooms. The bathrooms were the only thing I would change at this resort as they don't fit the rest of the resort, and need to be updated. The staff was very helpful, and the on-site facilities were great. The grounds were very tranquil, and the spa was nice. The golf course was average but considering it was five minutes from your room to the first tee I couldn't complain. The location though north of downtown was very easy to get to and only about a 25 minute drive to San Diego. It was actually nice to be in a quieter area. This is a good resort for families or couples as they have a couple pools, and it is very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for chicks, not all that practical”
Reviews.Author: jnorlund
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I am the type of person who values free meals, good lodging and practical things like wi-fi above looks. Having said that, this is a pretty nice place. We stayed a night for our anniversary and it has the looks of a classic Inn-type establishment. Their pool and jacuzzi's are open until 11 which is great and the room was pretty nice as well. They charge a fee for wi-fi, local calls, any and all food (no vending machines at all) and just about anything else you can think of. Beware that they try to include this "resort fee" on your bill automatically, I asked for it to be taken off. HDTV in the room, but no point since they only have limited channels and I don't think any of it actually was HD. They of course have a golf course and spa on site (kind of the point for most people) and I am sure the ladies love this type of place. Bottom line: for a romantic getaway where you can enjoy a few rounds while the wife gets a rubdown this place is for you. For any other travelers, go with a more practical choice.

Reviews.Title: “It's nice, but....”
Reviews.Author: Topenga
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our stay at Rancho Bernardo Inn this weekend (10/08). I must preface that I hate staying in hotels (but one cannot travel and avoid hotels); and I'm somewhat of a germophob (OK, a lot). I am extremely picky when it comes to cleanliness and customer service. Here is the scoop! We got a great rate of $150 per night through Hotels.com. We arrived late, so it was not easy to navigate the place in the dark. The room was decent, but nonetheless I brought my Lysol (wiped all the door knobs, the remote control and toilet). For those who stayed there in 2006 and talked about "tired rooms" and construction, it's all done now. It has a rustic/Spanish (not Mexican) feel to it, perhaps you can imagine being in Europe or in the country somewhere. It's nice overall, but keep in mind that it's not a new place (although they've updated their rooms). Here are few complaints: The beds were HARD. The pillows were strangly filled. Mine was hard as a rock and it felt full of knots. Another pillow was "deflated". The comforters were not stuffed well either (some won't keep you warm). The fan in the bathroom was very loud and rattled (old perhaps) The air conditioning was the same as the fan. The sales lady in the golf shop was snooty. If you are not as picky as I, and the above mentioned won't bother you, than you should try this place. Make sure you get a reduced rate though. The grounds are beautiful and the waiter we had was very helpful. Can't say the same for the hostess (probably her young age had something to do with it). My husband kept complimenting me on finding this place, so he liked it. He is even planning on bringing his sales team there for some R&R. Overall, it was better than I expected and considering the fact that these days it is rare to find a hotel that lives up to its rating, I would give them a B-/C+. Trust me, I've been to Ritz Carlton and St Regis, etc, that got even worse ratings from me. FYI - the location is in a residential area Make sure you ask and confirm what's included and what's not. In San Diego most hotels charge for parking (be aware of this). Never be afraid/intimidated to find out how much something costs before you agree to pay.

Reviews.Title: “What Service!”
Reviews.Author: Hockey93
Reviews.Content: I'm a San Diego local who had to stay here while my house was being fumigated. My family (my wife and I and 2 year old son) were so pleased with the experience from check in to check out words cannot describe. The Rooms were pristine and the beds are out of this world comfortable. When staying there we didn't think we were 5 miles from our house, it felt like a vacation in a foreign country. The restaurant is top notch and all the hotel staff were friendly and accommodating. If you want comfort and class on your next trip this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Far Below 4 or 5 star”
Reviews.Author: jpusz
Reviews.Content: I came in expecting 5 star and was very disappointed. This may have once been top notch, as the grounds are quite beautiful, but this hotel has major issues that need to be addressed: *service was far below standard at the Veranda restaurant and at Spa poolside *false advertising...screaming, unruly kids at the adult pool *not conducive for elderly...no elevators, too many stairs, dark, shower very dangerous to enter and get out of (nothing to hold on to) *smells like they need to rip out carpeting and get rid of mold, smells musty *room 271 had bleached out stains all over carpet, TV reception was terrible *way to expensive for what you get

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxed atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Charles01
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a week of our vacation at Rancho Bernardo Inn and we think it was one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in. I have read some other reviews which are less complimentary about the decor, and yet we still loved it. This is not a place for people who want marble bathrooms with gold taps - this is a place with a relaxed clubby atmosphere, with comfortable, rather than glitzy rooms. The food in the verandah restaurant was consistently of high quality, but for our last night we ate in the El Bizcocho fine dining restaurant and it was nothing less than superb. The staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful (the front of house manager went to a great deal of trouble to help us with route planning to local attractions) and we loved every minute of our stay. We had a couple of minor housekeeping issues (we asked for an early turndown for our kids, and it took a few days for this to work) but overall we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Checked in and right back out...”
Reviews.Author: Mica_Puppy
Reviews.Content: Two words...false advertising. This is not a luxury or sophisticated property as the hotel claims. The pictures on the inn's website are highly misleading. The property and its accommodations are rustic, not elegant. The outdoor walkways to the rooms are disgusting. Dirty, carpet full of stains, and also some graffiti on the walls. The room had a nice view of the gulf course but was the quality of a Holiday Inn. Plain and simple, if you're looking for an elegant hotel experience (such as The Four Seasons, Ritz, etc.), do not stay here. My husband and I were so turned off and disappointed in the Rancho Bernardo Inn, we checked out immediately after seeing the room. The only positive thing about this brief "stay" was the customer service. The front desk and bell staff were extremely friendly, accommodating, and professional. In fact, they referred us to The Grand Del Mar. We ended up staying there and it exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Beautiful - service too”
Reviews.Author: droopyandfriends
Reviews.Content: Charming. You feel away from it all, yet still close to all San Diego attractions. Service was some of the best I ever had. Food was fantastic and the Spa even better. Ya gotta go.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Overrated!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Derektravels
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to this one night getaway from LA we were going to have and I just got back tonight. I have to say from the moment we arrived my experience began to go downhill. When we pulled up at 8PM on a saturday night there was no valet or bellman to greet us. I simply opened my car door and my girlfriends and opened up the trunk and got my luggage out and waited for a few minutes and finally saw someone and I said, "Excuse me we are checking in." No one opened the door for us or anything. We finally got to our room and I have tosay the room besides the very nice TV looked like the room PRIOR to the multi-million dollar rennovations. The outside and inside decor of the whole hotel resembled a motel. HONESTLY!! The pools were outdated and had no real ambiance at all. The sheets and pillows were the worst I have slept on in so many years. The massage today was pretty good but I can tell you one thing, the spa that is supposed to be #1 in America is definetly not #1 in America! The food was actually pretty good and this morning we sat outside and had breakfast in the Veranda and the nest thing we all knew, a golf ball came flying at our heads. No warning or nothing so be careful. I am a golfer but did not golf this trip and the greens were nothing of a private country club that it is said to be. Very inconsistent with color and a mix of brown and dried grass every few feet. Overall, I have been to some pretty amazing hotels and this was suposed to be a great one, however I have truly no desire to go back here again and would be truthful to say I wouldn't feel comfortable reccomending it to people who wanted an incredible experience. Decent at best.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, great food”
Reviews.Author: travels_well
Reviews.Content: The RBI was recently rennovated since our last stay 5 years ago on our wedding night. We had a premium resort king which was nicey furnished and had a golf course view. The resort is very beautiful. The grounds are well maintained. My wife and I enjoyed a couples massage in an outside cabanna. The treatment was ok but the facalities were great. They have a salt water pool only open to spa guests. The pool is very big and we were the only ones in it. The spa lockers are also great. El Bizcocho, the main resturant, is one of the best places to eat in the world. It was as good as we remembered it. The food, wine and service were top notch. While dinner will cost a few hundred dollars, it was well worth the splurge for us. Lunch at the Veranda, the other resturant, was very disappointing. The service was not attentive and the food quality of my steak was poor. My wife's pizza was the better selection. One major complaint: In addition to the "resort fee" now common everyone, the RBI also charges another $12 or so for self-parking. These fees add another $25 onto an already expensive stay.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations? What Renovations?”
Reviews.Author: freqtrav88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in for an evening getaway on Sunday, May 18. I read the glowing reviews on this site and noticed the hotels's ads hyping their recent 25 million renovation. I thought the hotel would be the sort of resort worthy of a $350.00 room rate (again, on a Sunday evening). I was mislead. After checking in, we walked down the musty halls full of signs indicating various conference and wedding locations. The room, overlooking the back pool, was equally musty, dark, and damp. The decor was dated and I would compare it to an upscale Howard Johnson. Yes, it was clean and a good size. However, if there were renovations (again, find hard to believe), they were done on the cheap. The bathroom was the same - upscale Hojo style. Cheap tilework in the shower, plastic seeming fixtures, and the like. We decided to step out by the pool and relax. Let's just say it was a D.I.Y. pool. No one offered a drink, to help us with towels, or anything of the sort. We visited the spa pool on the following day - never even saw anyone. When I checked out, I was not asked whether I enjoyed my stay, otherwise, I would have mentioned some of my issues to the desk person. The excpetion to the overall D.I.Y. service was at the spa. I had a wonderful massage and the spa staff was terrific. The restaurant servers were very attentive as well - the food was standard hotel fare. Nothing great, nothing bad. Overall, this hotel deserves more of a 2 or 3 star rating. It certainly is not worthy of the price paid. Service was spotty (never saw bell service checking in our out - seemed non existent) with the exception of the spa and the restaurant. Perhaps if we were part of one of the many conferences happening, we would have received a better room or more attention. One last note, while we were at lunch, I heard the couple next to us complaining about the exact same issues. They were surpised by the shoddiness of their room and had asked to be moved. I would not stay at this hotel again and am disappointed by money poorly spent.

Reviews.Title: “Recently renovated resort---money well spent!”
Reviews.Author: toyee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Rancho Bernardo two years ago and found the resort average at best. I came back in May 2008 and it has significantly changed---for the better! The rooms and spa have been updated (flat screen TV, new furnishings, first class spa and private adult salt water pool). Also, during this trip I managed to walk around the grounds and appreciated the natural and relaxing feel of the resort. If you stay during a weekend, make sure and have their Sunday brunch. It's top notch and the service is great. It's now a legitmate 4 to 4 and 1/2 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: uko28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn in CA. It was a nice hotel. The room was very spacious and somewhat clean. The bathroom needs some work though. I have some problem sleeping at night because I can hear people closing their door or my top floor neighbor was walking very hard. We stayed at the garden building next to the access road on Bernardo Oak, it was pretty noisy in the morning. The landscaping is outstanding. Everything is very peaceful and calming. A little too pricy, they charged me $10 per day to park my rental car! And I have to pay $10 to use the pool at the spa area, this is rediculous. The pool on their main web page is NOT open for everyone. You can only use it for free if you pay for a spa!! Too much hidden fees!!!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: KBaldemi
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful stay at the Rancho Bernardo Inn. The grounds are immaculate and peaceful. The sweet smell of honeysuckle greeted us everytime we opened our front door. The staff works hard to insure that every guest is happy with their stay - excellent customer service. We really liked the fact that this resort is in the the center of a residential neighborhood; we believe this is what makes the resort so peaceful - no hustle and bustle. We went to the Wild Animal Park and San Diego Zoo during our stay. The Wild Animal Park is only 15 minutes away, and the SD Zoo is about 30 minutes away. I would highly recommend this resort if you want to get away from it all and enjoy the sound of silence; there is no night life at this resort - strictly relaxtion, spa and golfing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Facility”
Reviews.Author: DCvagabond1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a conference for two nights in January. This is a lovely resort, with a series of low-rise buildings spread over a hillside. It was pouring rain for most of the time that we were there, but even in the rain, it was a pleasant place to stay - attractively decorated, good food, nice landscaping and lovely pools. The one caveat is that this place seems to have no elevators - so anyone who doesn't want to walk a fair amount should think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Best in the Area by a Long Way”
Reviews.Author: williammic
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. Service could not have been better. You just drive up to the door, leaving the motor running on your car and a bellhop parks it for you instantly. Two more bellhops open both doors of the hotel. Smashing. When you want your car back, a bellhop instantly runs to get it. What more can you ask for? Breakfast is wonderful. We didn't try lunch or dinner. Yes, the bathrooms are showing their age, but they are very well maintained. Bedrooms are refurbished and beds and linens are excellent. Sound proofing is excellent. We stayed on a bed and breakfast package booked directly with the hotel, and it actually cost less than the local motels. At that price it is a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth A Visit”
Reviews.Author: Wedgewood
Reviews.Content: The Rancho Bernardo Inn is one of those resorts at which you need to stay for several days to unwind and enjoy the amenities. Unfortunately I was there for only one night, and that on business. From my brief stay, though, I saw that it is a warm, inviting resort consisting of a cluster of smallish buildings connected by winding garden paths. There are numerous small fountains and tranquil gardens scattered throughout. The lobby is an upscale rustic Southwestern decor, with an open fireplace. Very inviting and comfortable. The property is reached by driving to the far end of a residential area, meaning that there is no street traffic or noise. The rooms are extremely comfortable and are well equipped for business travelers. The inn automatically charges an all inclusive fee, so you don't have to pay extra for wireless internet access in the room or throughout the property. The hotel's business center was not all that well equipped, but the Rancho Bernardo town center (with a Kinkos) is nearby. It was a great location for our small business meeting, and I can see where a few days here could be very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Spa and Setting”
Reviews.Author: KiwiCowgirl07
Reviews.Content: **I stayed here for a conference two weeks before the San Diego fires, but I understand the hotel escaped the flames** I loved this hotel and would happily return. I was here for a conference, so stayed on property the entire time and never felt the need to escape (as one often does!). The property is just gorgeous - fountains and beautiful gardens everywhere. When you walk in, there are low ceilings with rustic beams and lovely old persian carpets, so it feels like a gorgeous old lodge rather than a huge hotel. There are several pools, including the amazing spa pool. This is reserved for spa guests or you can pay $10 for a day pass for other guests. Since we had several spa treatments, we got to use it for free, and took every advantage. It was not hugely warm but still sunny so I went swimming even though very few people were! Using the cabanas was a great way to keep out of the breeze and stay warm. There is little service there but the spa staff bought me water and offered me room service if I wanted. It fits with the serene spa experience. The spa itself is wonderful - the services were wonderful, top notch practitioners and location. You can even have outdoor massages (it wasnt warm enough for that when we were there!) We had a standard room but it was very nicely furnished. The bathroom was a little dated but still nice and a good size. The room overall was a decent size and the beds were very comfortable. Our room had a patio and we could hear a fountain at night. The food at the resort was also wonderful. We had most events catered by the hotel and the food was excellent every time - the sign of a well managed kitchen since feeding 200 people is always a stretch! We also ate at their high end restaurant - El Bizcocho - excellent food although very expensive. It is a bit pretentious and one of our friends was asked to leave and change out of jeans. I mean, its California, not Paris! That seemed a bit much. Anyway, once she was changed, we were seated and I had the vegetarian tasting menu which was intriguing. The food is quite complicated, which I am not usually a fan of, but it was delicious. It depends what you are into. I suppose if I had to describe what I like its local fresh ingredients (organic if possible) thoughtfully prepared, not disguised by 15 ingredients. They had an excellent wine list. We ate another meal at the more casual Veranda, which was also excellent and a bit simpler. The room service breakfast I had was fresh and tasty. Gosh I've said wonderful a lot, but that really sums it up. The brochures use the word elegant a lot. It is elegant, but more rustic elegant - its not the St Regis New York (which is what I think of when I think elegant) but its California elegant. Overall, I really enjoyed this hotel. It would be perfect for a girlfriend spa trip or a romantic CA escape.

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience”
Reviews.Author: OZisKTB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at RB a year ago, but our experience was limited by remodeling. We noted our issues on TA, and the resort contacted us to return for a subsidized visit. We were impressed! The people were tremendous, not just helping us, but filling in for each other. The teamwork we saw is a great reflection on the management. We felt welcomed by the valets. The check-in was thorough, striving to arrange every benefit for out stay. We had a terrific room, 625, with beautiful views of the valley and golf course, and was centered over the spaâ€™s pool. Our room was just the right size, well organized, and luxurious while maintaining the rustic feel of RB. Wireless access was fast and easy. The room came with a large LCD TV (analog) and DVD with normal hotel pay per view. We really liked the IHome alarm that allowed us to wake to our IPOD and recharged it too. Electrical outlets were sufficient, an unexpected plus. With the busy holiday season, we did not sample the El Biz Cocho restaurant. The Veranda was casual, family friendly, and served a well rounded menu of great food. We enjoyed one of the many hot tubs close to our room. The many outside fire places around the property were a perfect enhancement to the crisp winter Southern California air. We're novices to the spa experience, so we tried a couples massage. Nearly two hours of pampering together was one of the best things we've done together. The Spa staff was energetic, approachable (a plus for novices like us). and extremely knowledgeable. We didn't take the time to sample the salt water pool, but the steam bath, hot tubs, and relaxation areas were wonderful. We now would highly recommend this resort, and will be back to stay on our own $.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rancho Bernardo Inn but Non-smokers beware”
Reviews.Author: Marmalade2
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the Thanksgiving Holiday. Room was nice but was next to where the maids go in and out for supplies. Door slammed from 6a.m. to 10a.m. And I do mean slammed. We went to breakfast which was included in the $199 + tax + resort fee + parking charge. Service slow in the Veranda. The room itself seems too small for the property when they cannot use the patio to serve. We went there on our second day and was told it was a half hour wait. We did not wait. The next day we went at 10a.m. for breakfast and were told we had just missed the crowds that had a wait time of an hour. I don't know about you but wasting 2 hours on breakfast when you have places to go and people to see just doesn't make a whole lot of sense. I'd eat in the room next time. Food was ok. My main complaint would have to be that they allow smoking on balconies. If you want to leave your sliding door open for fresh air and there is a smoker next door - it goes right into your room. They should really make designated smoking and non smoking buildings. That way they could really segregate and control this second hand smoke better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, GREAT Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: LAGinagirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept, just before the horrible fires experienced in that area. The hotel is advertised as being completely upgraded, but that isn't completely accurate. It's evident that the rooms were superficially redone, but there were many remainders of what used to be a dated hotel. Still, our room was comfortable and clean and featured a large flatscreen (made for a happy sweetheart). The restaurant was the star of this property. The service was EXCELLENT, food was fabulous, wine was out of this world. Sure, it was pricey, but I've had the good fortune to experience some of the nicer restaurants both in the States and overseas and this one could compare with the best. One hitch: we were told that the restaurant had a no-denim policy. As I'd only brought 'dressy' jeans, we had to run out and purchase some slacks. I was not happy to see several women seated close to us wearing either faded denim jackets or even VERY casual washed out jeans (and an oversized sweatshirt!). However, once we brought our concern to the restaurant manager, he completely agreed with our observation and frustration, explained that it was the hostess' first night on the job and she didn't know how to correctly handle the other guests' wardrobe gaffes. Without us asking, he comped us our wine (an over $200 'gift'!) and brought us an on-the-house dessert that was beyond fantastic. The golf course was nice - nothing special, not great not horrible. Overall, our weekend was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Veranda Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Danni_7
Reviews.Content: No complaints with the room or the fancy dining room. The Veranda is another story. We had a dinner for 10 and one patron got more than he bargained for in his salad--a rather large piece of driftwood! Now everyone knows there is no driftwood in Rancho Bernardo so the waittress as much as accused him of planting it there himself. Even worse, when he wrote a letter of complaint, he never received the courtesy of a reply. Have also been there for breakfast. The service was fine--the food cold and nearly inedible.

Reviews.Title: “Needs major improvements”
Reviews.Author: ksamson
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the RB Inn many, many times over the last 20 years. I'm sorry to say that this resort has slowly and steadily gone down hill and our last stay in August will be our last stay. We stayed in a renovated room. The room and bedding are very nice, but why, oh why, didn't they renovate the bathrooms? The 70's tile really has to go and the faucet fixtures are so old. I can't remember the last time I saw a plastic ball shower knob. They have flat panel tv's but they are all configured incorrectly so the picture is so stretched out everyone looks 4' tall and twice the weight they actually are. We have stayed at this hotel twice in the last year - July and August. Both times we spent several days at the adult pool and were very disappointed in the lack of pool side drink/food service. One day no one ever appeared. Another day we moved to the bar across from the golf shop to sip a few drinks and watch the football game. The service was absolutely horrible. Our waitress and the bartender were so rude we had to get management to discuss their behavior (it's a long story). After returning 2 drinks that were mixed incorrectly, we watched as the bartender poured 2 separate drinks from our glasses into one cocktail shaker, added something, and poured into our 2 used glasses. The waitress attempted to reserve to us, when I informed her that we wouldn't be drinking those drinks and that what the bartender just did was a health code violation...... I could go on and on about the lack of response from her and the angry bartender - it was unbelievable! One morning we left our room early, walked out the door and was assaulted with the worst stench I've ever experienced. Apparently the sewer system had backed up the day before and they had scheduled maintenance - now don't you think they would have asked us to move rooms the night before???? It was so disgusting my husband and I almost threw-up trying to get to our car. The next morning, Sunday, we decided to sit outside in our little patio, have a cup of coffee and read the paper. Unfortunately, the gardener thought it was a good idea to use the blower to clear leaves on Sunday at 8:30 am and proceeded to do this and was actually blowing leaves into our patio! That was it for me. I met with the Asst. Manager, apparently the GM didn't have time, I told him all my complaints in a very nice way and my disappointment that I wouldn't be coming back to what use to be one of my favorite places. He listened with what seemed like interest (took notes), and I never heard another thing. I can't tell you how many friends have told me about their bad experiences at the RB Inn. I'm sorry to say, but I wouldn't recommend the Rancho Bernardo Inn to anyone. Good luck to them, but unless they get someone in there to retrain their staff they are going to continue to get crappy reviews and no return visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: MaximusMom
Reviews.Content: The Rancho Bernardo Inn is a peaceful oasis. Whether you're curling up with a book by the fireplace, taking a swim in one of the heated pools, or relaxing in one of the many whirlpools around the property, it's easy to find serenity anywhere on the property. The golf was great, as was the spa. I also enjoyed the breakfast buffet. The only downside is location; it's a bit of a drive to downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't all we expected”
Reviews.Author: Babs45
Reviews.Content: After dealing with their cranky website to book an overnite stay for my husband's 50th birthday, I recv'd an email form from the concierge asking me to give room preferences, spa appt. wishes, restaurant reservation desires etc. I filled out the form and waited for two weeks -- no call, so I contacted the hotel to find out that appt.s and reservations had been made -- but wrong days/times and services.... after correcting all the problems with several phone calls, I was assured that the hotel would make my husband's birthday VERY special. We booked a premium king room ($300), three premium spa appts. ($350+), used the spa pool ($10), ate dinner at El Bizcocho ($215), breakfast and lunch (another $100+) and paid to valet the car... let's see that's about $1000 for a 24 hour stay. What'd we get? A male masseuse (my husband prefers a female ) a room with a broken TV remote; a telephone with a blinking message light that would not turn off; free-loaders sneaking into the spa pool to gab during meeting breaks; dirty trays of food in the hallways; being seated in the middle of an empty dining room at a tiny table for two when we had expressly requested a booth for his birthday dinner; mediocre meals; terrible pillows. The spa was nice tho. Did we see any evidence of making my husband's birthday special in any way? Nope. I had three people assure me that this stay would be "wonderful" and "special" and something we wouldn't forget.... they knew by my bookings that we were going to spend some money -- and yet from all aspects this was just an average stay at a hotel that should have run about $500 -- tops. It wasn't what they told me it would be and it cost too much for what we got. Thanks RB Inn -- we'll go back to Rancho Valencia....

Reviews.Title: “Overall, it was nice”
Reviews.Author: ctheworld27
Reviews.Content: We were treated excellent when we first arrived, everything was..."this way/yes/is there anything that I can get for you Dr. and Mrs..." Nice touch that everyone seem to know our name instantly. They threw in a free breakfast on our, already very nicely priced room since we had mentioned that we were very disappointed that the tennis courts were not ready for use (undergoing some construction). The bellboy mentioned that the rooms had just been renovated...every room had $18,000 put into it...and it showed! Beautiful furniture, new carpet, 50 inch plasma TV, DVD player, iPod docking station, Aveda products in the bathroom!!! Amazing! Only grip-the bathtub became slightly backed up, but apparently the maid noticed it, told the crew and it was fixed before we came back to the room in the afternoon! Beds were VERY comfortable with tons of soft pillows! The Veranda cafe was incredible when it came to the food, but the service was HORRIBLE! It took the wait staff 15 minutes to bring us water and coffee one morning. From the time we ordered, till we ate was about 25 minutes...and it wasn't that busy. This could use some work. The grounds are so beautiful. We loved the "adults only pool". Fresh towels were laid out, used ones were taken up fairly quickly...plus there was a bar...and, did I mention...NO loud kids! " :) There are fun activites planned each night...we attended the managers mixer at the adult pool...all you could eat and drink (top shelf) for 2 hours with live entertainment. Very nice touch. Many people showed up for this....they were liberal with the pours and immediately restocked food once it disappeared (it was tasty!) They even have activites like a movie on the lawn, or will set up a "tent" in your room for the kids to camp out with Smores. Cute ideas. Puzzles and games in the lobby. The Spa was incredible. The fitness room was fully equipped with all new machines and plenty of new cardio machines (2 elliptical, 3 bikes and 5 treadmills), each with it's own plasma tv with personal control! Filtered water, fresh towels and fruit there for during and after your workout. Overall...We loved it! We wanted to give each of our parents a weekend getaway there. Great place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Time at this Golf/Spa resort!”
Reviews.Author: mcuenca
Reviews.Content: My Finance and I stayed there during the Labor Day Weekend! We spent most of our time at the brand new Spa. The women's section was clean and modern. It had a small jacuzzi and steam room. Each guest was provided her own locker, a nice robe and use of spa towels. No other added amenities such as lotions, face wash, swabs, hair products. We had the couples massage/ deep tissue - indoors. The service was good, relaxing. The outdoor "adult" spa pool and cabanas were nice. Although pool side service for drinks was a bit lacking. There is no assigned server for the pool. You have to ask the spa to send someone down. Nevertheless, it was very serene (no kids) and it was not crowded at all - even for a holiday weekend. The room was nice - 3 star quality. The outside of the building looks a bit rustic. The inside of the room looks updated/ remodeled. The bathroom was fairly spacious: dual sinks, bathtub and separate shower. It was clean! The bath products were Aveda. The furniture in the room was a bit awkward. The bed was too small. It was a "full" size. (even if we requested a large bed.) The mattress was comfortable, right amount of firmness. However, the couch was too big for the room - it partialy blocked access to the sliding door to the balcony. We had a nice view of the golf course. We had a large flat screen TV - Nice. The walls/floors were a bit thin - could hear some chatting next door. But we were not disturbed by it. I would not recommend the "Veranda" restaurant at the resort. Very mediocre. The concerige was wonderful! She recommended a local restaurant called "Cafe Luna" - small, quaint, Italian eatery, with excellent food. Its about 10 minutes from the resort. We paid $200/night. Probably cheaper on non-holiday weekends. We would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice scenery”
Reviews.Author: MartiLittleRock_AR
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. If you want a quiet retreat this is the place. The grounds are beautiful. Some of the rooms are renovated and some are not. I stayed in a room that was not, and it was okay. The hotel is not really close to anything, so if you want to be within walking distance to attractions don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Casually Elegant, Cozy and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: WiseOldOwlLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: My family (all 13 of us) stayed a weekend at Rancho Bernardo for our folks 50th wedding anniversary. We had heard that they recently remodelled and were looking very forward to our stay. Upon arrival we realized the folks forgot their clothes, that was a hoot, but we remedied it by shopping at the nearby mall, which was an added plus to the location of this resort. The staff seemed friendly at all times, even when requesting feather pillows and extra shampoo's for our rooms. The most impressive aspect of the weekend was the fabulous Dining on the premises. The 2 Restaurants were equally wonderful. The staff at the Restaurants were exceptional. Service was flawless.The food was fresh, delicious and plentiful. The package deals are really the way to go, as they offer 2 meals a day at either Restaurant for 2. You save quite a bit by purchasing your room this way. The rooms are nice, complete with 2 sink bathrooms, a small refrigerator, a safe, a large flat screen TV with cable, and plenty of extra space to lounge. You can request a lake view as well, but all views are lovely from the balconies. Overall, a great place to spend some quality time with loved ones at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely place”
Reviews.Author: gshirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at Rancho Bernardo Inn for a 4 days week-end for our 2 years anniversary, and we had a wonderful time. Everyone was very nice and the service was good. The room was very nicely renovated and spacious, with a nice terrace. We also used the Spa and we received great service and it was very relaxing Spa. I would highly recommend having dinner and brunch on Sunday at El Bizcocho, the food was absolutely delicious, some of the best food I have had and great service. The only 2 issues we had were that we were on the 3 floor and there is no elevator and I am 6 months pregnant so after a long day it was a little hard, and the service and food at La Veranda (at least for breakfast) was very poor and slow and the food was not very good. But, otherwise I would definetly recommend the hotel for a nice and quiet stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: tkhossfeld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RBI with our two small children and had a wonderful experience. The family pool was great fun with other guests and their children. The rooms were outstanding. The 42" plasma was a hit for our 3 year old to watch cartoons. Rooms were tastefully decorated and recently renovated. The service was outstanding from the moment we arrived. Room service was great and they called about an hour after our meal arrived to ensure everything was to our liking. I also called to request something from housekeeping.
