They brought it almost instantly and then the front desk called about 30 minutes later to make sure everything had arrived. All in all it was a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Quiet, with some Oddities”
Reviews.Author: SaMajestee
Reviews.Content: Rancho Bernardo Inn is a nice distance from San Diego, enough to feel relaxed and secluded, yet too remote if you want to go into town for little more than a day trip to the zoo, ie zipping out for dinner is quite a drive. The best thing about the location is the proximity to the Wild Animal Park. If that is a main highlight in your travel agenda, definitely stay here. The property itself is well decorated and comforting, quiet, safe,fountains and wells everywhere, and though it is nice that there are two separate pools (one for kids and one adult pool) the adult pool was in a courtyard surrounded by rooms, and lots of foot traffic. The jacuzzi next to the adult pool was great, could fit about 18 people in there if you wanted to. There was a nice gleaming mediterranean pool in sight, yet it was part of the spa, and was being set up for an event while we were there, so we couldn't enjoy it. The grounds are dotted with cheesy motel lodge style jacuzzis hidden behind fenced in mini courtyards with a single bistro table with chair and covered in dirt and floating leaves. Not so fancy, eh? Note that this is a golf resort, and for golfers, it must be amazing, the course looked really nice. My boyfriend and I are not golfers, but never mind staying at golf-emphasis resorts, however we were looking forward to playing tennis, but guess what? The courts are under construction, and most of them have been torn down. As far as the rooms go, when they give you the option to stay on the first or second floor, always choose the second. First floor you get a sliding door and patio which EVERYONE can walk by and gawk at you, where as second floor has a balcony, and more privacy. The room had a slightly musty odor, but a super comfy bed and nice soft pillows. Ipod dock made getting ready feel more at home. The bathroom was OK, tub and shower were really nice, two sinks and plenty of space for toiletries, they supplied Aveda products which was also a nice touch, but the one pet peeve was that the bathroom didn't have a fan, which meant it would get very steamy after a hot shower, but worse, no circulation for "odor." We ate lunch out on the terrace facing the course, this was possibly my favorite part, late afternoon watching all of the golfers coming back from their games, we enjoyed bloody marys, a mediocre salmon and an amazing, perfectly cooked risotto (with a mysterious mushroom mousse surrounding it.) We later in the evening enjoyed cocktails at the upstairs upscale restaurant, while we were considering dinner there. Food here is supposed to be amazing, but the environment felt a little too stuffy for our taste so we went out of the resort exploring (wish we hadn't, in retrospect dinner at the resort would have likely been much better.) All in all I would say this is a great place for golfers, or those who want something very quiet and safe with good food and nice cocktails. This is the perfect place to come back and unwind from a day out looking at animals, and for lovebirds there is one item on the room service menu I would recommend: bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Cork_Boy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn as part of our honeymoon. Right from the off, we were well impressed. We were allocated a large comfortable room overlooking the golf course. Room furnishings were excellent and everything seemed to work fine - including the 42" plasma screen TV. Rooms were well sound proofed, so we got a great nights sleep every night. Staff were always helpful and friendly, especially Karen the Concierge, who gave us lots of advice and tips on things to do locally. There are a number of swimming pools on the property, including one exclusively for adults, which helps if you are trying to just chill out. Food was excellent, although dinner for 2 in the restaurant costs about $160+tip, with breakfast for 2 approx. $60+tip, so the tab can build up during your stay. The only negatve for us was a couple of sneaky charges added to our bill at checkout, particularly one for $15/day for replenishing coffee making supplies in your room (we didn't even use these!). All in all, a grat place to go for a relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Best part of our honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrsmatto
Reviews.Content: What a great place!!! At first I was hesitant to stay so far from downtown San Diego but this place is well worth the extra time in the car. We arrived to a beautiful room overlooking the fountain. The room was large and the bathroom spectacular. Double sinks, tub to two, and a standup shower with terrific water pressure. We encountered a problem with the 42" plasma screen tv and within seconds the on-site engineer was there to help. When he couldn't fix the problem, we were given another room with exactly the same beautiful accomodations. A few moments later there was a knock on the door with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries from the manager welcoming us and offering any further assistance if needed. Nicely done!!! Make sure you eat outside on the veranda at sunset. It's beautiful and the golf course is lovely to look at. Well done all around....

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: beetrvln
Reviews.Content: We had a quick trip to San Diego, and decided to stay at the Rancho Bernardo Inn, due to the location and proximity of a few business meetings scheduled. We enjoyed the resort very much. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and I believe all the rooms have been renovated. Our room was beautiful, the beds were very comfortable, and extremely clean. For those of you playing golf, the rates are very, very reasonable after 4 p.m. All in all, it was enjoyable, and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay”
Reviews.Author: DawnWeins
Reviews.Content: What a plesant surprise for my Boyfriend and I! We stayed here for a wedding we were attending in San Diego. We thought it was a little far, but WELL WORTH the extra miles. So relaxing, beautiful decor, lovely staff and clientele. The rooms were HUGE! The best part? Seperate adult pool and kids pool! Never felt like I was going to get splashed when I just wanted to relax. It was a big old school for younger folk, but I happen to enjoy that, so it worked out for us. The only con was the restaurant (not El Bizcocho) had terrible wait svc. But we were so relaxed, it hardly mattered. Ohh and we got an amazing deal on a travel website for the room! Try off peak - and you'll be surprised what you pay!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to eat and relax”
Reviews.Author: tchrtravler
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter the property and enjoy the rambling gardens, blazing fireplaces, cozy nooks in which to relax, and personalized service (EVERYONE knows your name) you'll know you're in for a treat. The rooms are small but supremely comfortable. Great attention is paid to detail, and the beds are enough to sink into all day. The restaurant, though, El Bizcocho, is not to be missed. The meal there was the best I've ever eaten. My husband and I, who enjoy travelling to eat, agree regularly that the meal there was the best we've ever eaten. We opted for the tasting menu, a wise choice, and were surprised again and again by the fresh, elegantly prepared and presented, and creative dishes. You won't regret your stay, or your meal. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Old and Tired”
Reviews.Author: skyservicemiami
Reviews.Content: I had read previous reviews of this hotel and I just wonder if their eyes were closed or had just never experienced a true resort before, but I had asked for a "newly renovated" room and I supposedly got one. The furniture was old and dated, the bedspreads and linens were far from luxurious in fact i equated them to my grandmothers spare bedroom style wise. The hotel is so far away from San Diego it should never be confused as near the city, its in a residential neighborhood way off the beaten path with nothing close in walking distance, a car is a must here as a taxi ride from SAN is over $60.00! There are plenty of luxurious hotels in San Diego so if travelling to the area definately take a pass on Rancho Bernardo Inn and head for the W San Diego a much better choice and value for money paid

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: migponce2003
Reviews.Content: Couldnt ask for more in a hotel/resort. I reserved this hotel for my parents that were visiting and they were thrilled with the ambiance and friendly helpful service. The entrance to the hotel is only the beginning to this wonderfully decorated resort. The decorations- especially the water fountains and fireplaces make this resort have a homely sophisticated feel. The rooms were nice especially my room that had a balcony overlooking the pool and hot tub. My only regret is that I didnt get to play a round of golf or stay long enough to participate in one of the resort events(the s'mores bar sounded good). I would reccomend this resort in a heart-beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great dining- location.”
Reviews.Author: cupton
Reviews.Content: Very nice accomodations. Relaxing and away from the busy freeways, etc. Stayed for business over 3 months. Dining was 5 star, great for client meetings. And, a great wine cellar. Good service and room rates are moderate so you won't break the bank. Golfers like the locale--but I am not one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the RBI”
Reviews.Author: RBPheonix
Reviews.Content: I visit the inn a few weeks ago. I was very impressed with the ammenities as well as the service. I would recommend the Rancho Bernardo Inn to anyone interested in staying in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've been to in a long time”
Reviews.Author: Traveler3390
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and had a great stay. Loved everything! I wanted to take the bed home, it was by far the best night sleep I have had in a long time. The staff was extremely helpful and attentive. And it seems they are going through some upgrades to the hotel also...I definatley recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Diego. It is secluded and very quiet...away from the busy downtown SD area, but just a short 25-30 minute drive if you want to go downtown

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: hwilson624
Reviews.Content: The Rancho Beranrdo Inn is simply the perfect getaway while in San Diego. It is reminiscent of old European charm. The decor is exquisite and the service is impeccable. There are two restaurants, the Veranda and El Bizcocho, which is an incredible dining experience. The wine selection is by far the most extensive that my wife and I have ever seen and the attention to detail by the staff is unmatched. The golf course is both picturesque and very challenging, especially the 18th hole. You will not be disappointed. We have been staying at the Inn for over 10 years when in town.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: KeithRSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn several times over the years and are always impressed. We travel a great deal, but there's no place like the Inn! Fabulous property, stunning rooms, and service that's second to none. Highly recommended for both the business traveler and for vacation. Don't forget to check out the spa!

Reviews.Title: “A great get-away for local or out-of-town travelers”
Reviews.Author: taustin
Reviews.Content: I am an event planner and several of my clients have hosted their weddings and events at the Rancho Bernardo Inn. I love when brides and grooms pick RBI as their venue. RBI catering and staff are very easy to work with and their events are "spot on" compared to other venues I've held events at. Their grounds also offer several perfect backdrops for ceremonies, and wedding photographers love the picturesque qualities RBI has too. RBI also offers a comfortable stay for guests with great restaurants, a spa, golf, and pools. Its warm, hacienda/early California feel is very inviting and relaxing for any special event or getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Rancho Bernardo Inn is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell317
Reviews.Content: This property is quite a gem located in the north county area of San Diego. The property is expansive (you can get lost!) and is very beautiful. it is a really great place for a quiet romantic getaway. The lobby has a very old world feel with lots of antiques and fireplaces. I stayed in one of their large suites which was fabulous. There is plenty of room for a whole family in one of those. The food at the restaurants was absolutely delicious! I didn't go in the pool but it looked nice enough. It was an easy drive to get to the Wild Animal Park, but a little far from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for family get togethers and events of all kinds”
Reviews.Author: paperqueen
Reviews.Content: Wow! My sister was married at the Wildlife Park in San Diego and most family and friends luckily stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn. We held three meals there and were estatic about both the service and the food. The service at the hotel is tip top bar none. The staff (everyone from the gardners to the conceirge) went to great lenghts to accomodate every need. We visited with a toddler and a seven year, all found plenty to do there. The staff is great especially the conceirge who knows San Diego inside out. We enjoyed a day at the pool complete with food and drinks! What a special place to visit and catch up with family and friends. WE HIGHLY RECOMMMEND THE RANCHO BERNARDO FOR FAMILY REUNIONS, GOLF, MEETINGS ANYTHING! YOU WILL NOT REGRET THE CHOICE. The landscape and views are wonderful. We loved the spa, worth every penny! We will come back each year, that is if we can!

Reviews.Title: “Good, if you get the right room and a reduced rate”
Reviews.Author: geo3
Reviews.Content: I think people's perception of this place would depend to a great extent on what room they got and what they paid. I got a substantially reduced rate (about $185 US) and quiet room with a nice view of the grounds, so I was pleased with the place overall. Positives: 1. Beautiful grounds. The balcony had a nice view and was a good place to just relax and read. 2. I had a nice room with good quality furniture, and it was clean. Apparently this varies somewhat. 3. Good (if overpriced) restaurant. Particularly nice if you can eat outdoors. 4. Location. People's opinions vary, but I personally liked the quiet suburban location. The San Diego zoo or downtown was only about 30 minutes away outside of rush hour. There were plenty of shops, grocery stores or restaurants within a reasonable driving distance. Negatives: 1. Definitely overpriced at full price. Don't consider it unless you can get some kind of reduced price. 2. The staff varied in their helpfulness. My room was missing a lamp by the workdesk/internet connection. In the morning I asked to have one put there, but apparently that particular front desk person did nothing about it. I asked again in the evening (to a different front desk person) and a lamp was delivered within ten minutes. I would stay here again, but only if it was at reduced price.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: amh-c
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are active people that enjoy simple comfortable decor and a bit of personality. The decor could be mistaken for worn but it is more of a country southwestern feel than shabby. Cons: Some things are a bit outdated or could be better. For instance, the beds could be more comfortable and a more central location for the spa would be an improvement (you have to walk up a hill to get back to your room after a treatment.) Night management needs work- they actually closed the pools/jacuzzi early for no good reason. Pros: The location of Rancho Bernardo Inn is excellent. San Diego, La Jolla, Julian, and the Anza Borrego Desert are all within two hours. They have a shuttle available at the hotel and great concierge staff. The restauant has wonderful food/wine pairings.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be!”
Reviews.Author: tedschred
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay again! This is my second visit, and I enjoy the low density California ranch-style property. It is a very peaceful place to be. The staff is extremely accomodating and friendly without being intrusive. And the food in the 2 restaurants is a big treat. We were able to eat outside which is a real treat, overlooking the golf course. The rooms are clean and well appointed, and it's a very warm and comfortable place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LuLindy
Reviews.Content: I spent last weekend at the Rancho Bernardo and was very disappointed with the experience. Even though it has nice surroundings, the hotel room was little better than staying in a Best Western. The hotel room, while large and comfortable, was old and very tired looking in terms of decor, the bathroom was extremely basic and there was hardly anything in the minibar. You are charged extra for parking even though free parking outside the hotel would be a significant walk. The main pool was closed to hotel guests all day Saturday even though you pay an extra resort fee for use of the facilities. I called for a spa appointment two weeks in advance and was informed there were no appointments available for the entire weekend. There was a disgusting smell in the main bar (like sewage). Room service was extremely slow. The concierge was very helpful but that is about the only good thing I can say about this place. Don't be fooled by the 5 star rating - it falls shockingly below that standard.

Reviews.Title: “Has Potential but Needs Serious Updating”
Reviews.Author: qaz123
Reviews.Content: This could be very nice resort, but as it currently is, I would say it is an average place that does really not merit a stay, unless you can get a good rate. We happened to get a pretty good rate for a Saturday night in high season for $199 all in. I would not pay a penny more, and I really don't even think that the our stay was worth that, but given the minimum stay requirements at other places, this suited us fine. The room was quite tired. They need to update it with new fittings in the bathroom, new furniture, new rugs, the whole deal. The hallways etc. could also use a renovation. The only positives were 1) the view from our balcony, though the furniture on the balcony did not encourage lounging (plastic netted chairs) 2) the Aveda brand toiletries. The "adult" pool area is ok, but the poolside "bar" is depressing and there were a notable lack of chairs. The gym is serviceable, though nothing fantastic, and the spa seemed very average. We did not play golf. The grounds--fountains, various stone pathways, etc.--did lend an air of serenity to the resort, which was much appreciated. We did have breakfast at the Veranda restaurant and this was a very good meal. We sat outside, which was lovely. This is the only part of the resort that merits truly positive mention.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: SanFran35
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of a wedding group this weekend. Listed as a 4+ star hotel, the service and surroundings were more along the lines of a 2 star. The room was tired and old, the bar smelled of sewage to the point where we had to leave shortly after ordering a drink, when we asked the bartender about it he responded 'yeah, it's awful, been like this for weeks....'!!!! Called room service in the morning for bottle of water and was told would take 50 mintues to deliver (and they slap on $4 for 'delivery fee) They closed their main pool area for a 'private corporate event' until 4.00 p.m. on Saturday despite this being the pool for adults and by far nicer than the sub par 'childrens pool' we were directed to upon equiring at the front desk. So called 'Manager' on duty was unapologetic, unhelpful and rude. When asked why they would close down their main pool on a Saturday in high season to full paying guests (bare in mind you are also charged a $15 per day 'resort fee' and $15 'parking fee' in addition to your room rate for using such great facilities), I was told that it would 'only be until 4.00 p.m.' i.e., the whole day.... Unreal. Spend your hard earned cash elsewhere. This is a sub par, tired property with terrible service charging top dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: Dizneyfann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from September 11,2006 to September 15,2006. At first we we're very pleased and excited. The employees were very nice and the grounds were well kept. At check-in we received a letter stating that we were on the "Stay and Play" package which allowed us options. It was one option per person per day. So my husband and I chose spa options. Since I was surprised that we were given options I asked the spa pesonnnel, the front desk (twice) if this was correct. All answers were ,"Yes, go ahead. You will not be charged." So my husabnd and I used to the options. At checkout the spa charges were removed because we were on a package. Our final bill was $455.98. Well, today I look at my credit card statement and there is an additional charge for $645.00. I call the hotel and the manger says, "Sorry, you weren't on that package so we billed you for the options you used." Of course I was not told that anytime during the stay or even when we checked out. The charge is still being disputed. Would I have stayed here again if this would not have happened? Yes. But since this has happened I won't go anywhere near this place again. All I have to say is buyer BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Rancho Bernardo Inn”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth55
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn for the last several years while we visit some family that live in San Diego. I look forward to to this trip all year! We were only there for 4 short nights however I would have loved to stay longer. We did manage to spend some time at the family pool where we ordered a wonderful lunch and enjoyed some drinks by the pool. It was a great afternoon for the adults along with the kids who spent the day in the pool playing with some of the pool toys that were provided by the resort. One morning I even had the pleasure of going down to the spa and having a wonderful swedish american massage. And after the massage I spent some time in the steam room... I could have spent all day in the spa but I had to get back to the room to spend some time with the family. On the evening we ate in the Veranda, there was an excellent buffet that was going on so half of our party ate from the buffet and then the rest of us ordered off their menu. Of course, we also made time to eat in El Bizcocho. We didn't bring the kids along since this restauarant is much more of a "fine dining" experience. After reading all of the stories about El Bizcocho's chef, we were definitely not disappointed. The food, presentation and service there is absolutely incredible. I can say nothing but good about the Rancho Bernardo Inn - Everyone should experience it.

Reviews.Title: “great golf”
Reviews.Author: liketogolf
Reviews.Content: we just got back from 4 days at the rancho bernardo inn and we had a great time. the golf course is excellent - nicely maintained. we had a "stay and play" package which turned out to be pretty reasonable. our room was spacious and had a beautiful view of the golf course. restaurants are just "so so" and very expensive. the El Biz restaurant has a wonderful reputation but we didn't really like what we ordered for an entree. the pool is small for the size of the hotel and there aren't enough lounges on the pool deck. that's the only downside of the property. we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: DivaJ
Reviews.Content: My family and I take a vacation every year. We chose to go to the San Diego area to visit Legoland and Seaworld for my two year old son. We stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn for four nights. We found this hotel in our Entertainment Book. This is suppose to be a four star hotel but I found should be no more than a three. This hotel had some good things I liked and bad things that I did not like. When we arrived at the hotel on Sunday, August 6, the valet service was great. They unloaded our bags with no problems. The grounds were beautiful. It was very green and very well manicured. They had two pools. One for families and one for adults only. I thought that was great. The fitness center was ok. Here is the part I did not like. The room was very large. We had plenty of space but was not very clean. The carpet had stains on it. The mini bar was not stocked. The bed spread was very out dated and was old and dengy. The bed skirt had stains and holes in it. I saw atleast 3 pieces of hair on the sheets. It was not our hair because we had just checked in. The chair that was in the room had a number of stains on it. The drapes had a number of stains and was old. The decore was out dated. I always carry lysol with me when I stay at a hotel and I used the whole can spraying the beds, bathroom, carpet, drapes and anything else I could. I never felt comfortable in this room. The straw that broke the camels back is I saw three spiders in the room over my four night stay. I hate spiders and to have them in my room was unacceptable. The balcony was nice to have. We were in the very back of the hotel which when you walked out, you were in the parking lot. I read the reviews from other guest before making our reservations and thought maybe I would just give it a try. I should have listened to the other guest that stayed there. I would have left but had pre-paid for the room through the Entertainment company and was to late to get a refund. I should of listened to people that had already stayed there and gave their opinion in their reviews. The staff was nice but I will never stay there again. I didn't listen to the other people but will in the future. THIS IS NOT THE FOUR STAR QUALITY I'M USE TO.

Reviews.Title: “needs some help, wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: ob23
Reviews.Content: overall the property was adaquate but overpriced, really need to step up on the ground maintenance. service was poor at the veranda restaurant. had reservations at their higher end restaurant, but they later booked it for a private party. lots of other guests were also left in the lurch and unfortunately the management didn't think ahead to completely staff their second restaurant which was only half full. i was told that they didn't have enough servers to seat anymore parties. this left only the lounge area to get any food and they were swamped. luckily, the one server working this area was wonderful (vanessa you are great!) also, the adult pool only had 10 lounge chairs. asked a staff person to see if they could bring some up from the family pool, he made a phone call but nothing ever happened. overall, disappointed and would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Rancho Bernardo Inn disappointing”
Reviews.Author: caligirl111
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Rancho Bernardo Inn Saturday evening with a pre paid reservation. We were told by the girl on duty at the front desk "sorry we can't accomodate you, we are full" I then explained we had a fully paid reservation and phoned the prior evening to confirm our reservation of a room with 2 beds and the time of our arrival. I was then told "sorry, it's first come, first served." I will skip many details but the bottom line was I had to get the manager and argue for something I already paid for. We were finally given a room, which was very nice and I must say the grounds are beautiful, although the spa was going through renovations. We only ate breakfast at the Veranda which was very good. I believe this hotel is lovely, it just needs better trained staff and clairification on hotel policies. It is a bit out of the way being situated in a residential area but close enough to the freeway so you can get many places quickly. Oh, as for the hotel being full, we only saw one other person in our building the entire time we were there so i'm not sure what that was about.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, Sub-par Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn numerous times for business. Although this hotel is near our client's office, my colleagues rarely stay here, opting instead for a nearby 2-star hotel at the same (corporate) rate. The grounds are beautiful, the rooms nice, but the service is erratic at best. Certainly not what you would expect of a self-proclaimed luxury hotel. Many of the employees are young and inexperienced - they seem to be students who are never there long enough to get to know the hotel or its policies well. Many times, I have asked a simple question that had to be referred to a supervisor. In addition, the rooms are not well maintained. On different occasions, I have had a stopped-up bathtub, a non-working internet connection, a broken alarm clock, and quite a few mis-programmed keys. The food is delicious, but the bar is the only place to get good service with it. Individually, these are not big issues. But together, they really detract from the serene, relaxing atmosphere that this hotel could so easily support.

Reviews.Title: “good north county location”
Reviews.Author: anovick
Reviews.Content: i have family in the area and have tried the other local hotels. this is by far the best in the area. we love the convienent location. near the city and near the mountains. they try to charge extra parking but always take it away when asked. people pleasant great grounds and pools. gym so so but on the whole we always go back

Reviews.Title: “Bad plumbing, uneven service, bill was never correct”
Reviews.Author: hughseattle
Reviews.Content: Some aspects of this place are fine. Food service is a strength. In four stays, my final bill was never correct once. And I stopped billing items to my room tab after my 2nd stay. Hospitality is uneven with some highs and some disappointing lows. The plumbing is challenged; getting attention for plumbing problems was easy one time, problematic another time. Lighting is consistently dim. I stayed at this place multiple times before moving to something more modern, more hotelish.
